richmond.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for the Richmond Times-Dispatch newspaper, reporting on news, politics, and sports in Richmond and the state of Virginia.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Richmond Times-Dispatch is owned by BH Media Group Inc., a subsidiary of publicly traded, Omaha, Nebraska-based Berkshire Hathaway, which is run by billionaire investor Warren Buffett. BH Media Group owns more than 30 daily newspapers, including its flagship publication, The Omaha World-Herald. It also owns more than 70 weekly newspapers and other printed publications in the United States, as well as one television station. In July 2018, Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded newspaper chain that owns more than 40 daily newspapers across the country, began managing operations for BH Media’s newspapers under a partnership announced by the two companies.

BH Media generates revenue from advertising and subscriptions for its printed publications and digital products. Its publications have won numerous awards for their journalism, including a Pulitzer Prize in 2018.

Content

Content on Richmond.com is fact-based and focuses on news in and around Virginia’s capital city. The website covers local schools, municipal and county governments, weather, health, collegiate sports, tragedies, and crime. It publishes national and international news from The Associated Press. Richmond.com also features photo galleries of local events. An expansive video section on the website includes the RTD News Minute, which offers a daily rundown of news in the Richmond area. Richmond.com publishes searchable databases of local and state government employees’ salary information, made possible from public information requests through Virginia’s Freedom of Information Act. The website has a paywall that allows nonsubscribers to read a limited number of articles a month for free.

Credibility

Reports on Richmond.com are based on original reporting and interviews. The site also uploads primary source material, including court documents, for readers to download and read. Richmond.com regularly publishes corrections and clarifications to articles, often explaining the reason for the error. Headlines match the content of the text.

Transparency

The About Us section of Richmond.com includes first-person pieces written by Times-Dispatch staffers called “Why I do what I do.” In those posts, the staffers explain their motivations for working in journalism. The About Us page discloses that the newspaper is part of BH Media.

The site links to writers’ email addresses for users clicking on a byline. A Contact Us page provides phone numbers and email addresses for various departments, including the newsroom and the opinion section. Richmond.com has a specific opinion section. It touts columns on its news pages, clearly marking them as local columnists. Advertisements are clearly distinguished from news content.

History

The Richmond Times-Dispatch began in 1850 as the Richmond Dispatch. It merged with the Richmond Times in 1903. The Times-Dispatch won a 1948 Pulitzer Prize, print journalism’s top award, for editorial writing that condemned racial segregation.

Since 1980, the newspaper’s editorial board has not endorsed a Democrat for president. The Times-Dispatch endorsed a Republican in each election except in 2016, when it supported the Libertarian Party’s candidate, Gary Johnson. The Richmond.com domain name was created in 1997.
